question:
In light of Voyager-2 entering into the interstellar space in November, consider the following statements:
  1. The spacecraft has flown past all the 4 gas giant planets.
  2. It visited the Saturnian system before visiting the Jovian system.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Voyager-2 is a NASA spacecraft launched in 1977 as a part of the Voyager program. It is the only spacecraft to have studied all 4 gas giant planets of the solar system: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. Over its life, it has discovered 16 moons and some interesting space phenomena like Neptune’s Great Dark Spot.  Statement 2 is incorrect: The primary mission of Voyager-2 to use a single spacecraft to study all the outer planets was conceptualised based the alignment of these planets that occur periodically. When this occurred in 1970-80, the spacecraft was used to study them sequentially- Jupiter (Jovian system), Saturn (Saturnian system), Uranus and Neptune.
